DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Two Greater Involved Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to > 2 involved lymph nodes to which cancer is has spread from the primary tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Two Greater Involved
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to > 2 involved lymph nodes to which cancer is has spread from the primary tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:Notable in size, number, measure, magnitude, degree, or effectiveness.:Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
Notable in size, number, measure, magnitude, degree, or effectiveness.
Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
